article:
The oil and gas industry is usually divided into three major sectors: upstream,
midstream and 'downstream.' The downstream sector commonly refers to the
refining of petroleum crude oil and the processing and purifying of raw natural
gas, [http://www.trencome.com/petroleumindustry.htm Petroleum industry] [http://wpccanada.com/yc/industry-info/about-the-
industry/upstream-midstream-downstream.html Upstream, midstream & downstream] [http://www.psac.ca/business/industry-
overview/ Industry Overview] from the website of the Petroleum Services
Association of Canada (PSAC) as well as the marketing and distribution of
products derived from crude oil and natural gas. The downstream sector touches
consumers through products such as gasoline or petrol, kerosene, jet fuel,
diesel oil, heating oil, fuel oils, lubricants, waxes, asphalt, natural gas, and
liquified petroleum gas (LPG) as well as hundreds of petrochemicals.

Midstream operations are often included in the downstream category and
considered to be a part of the downstream sector.
